website_summaries.verdict: This solid winter cover comes in just about every size for in-ground pools.
pros: The cover that is going the distance with an 8-year warranty
Water does not leak through to the pool
cons: The warranty should be longer for a premier product like this

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for the Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this cover for our large kidney shaped pool, with hot tub, and it covered the entire surface well. Of course there was some extra cover fabric at the corners which we tucked under the water tubes. We had also previously purchased a pool leaf net, which we also installed. The Blue Wave Bronze cover seems to be very well made, especially for the price. We will have to see how it holds up for the Louisiana winter and leaves. The warranty is a bit misleading in that it is heavily prorated after year one, and you must pay for shipping. Also, the warranty shown on the Amazon listing is for a different model with a 12-year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Richard & Diane Meyer

customer_reviews.title: The first year it was great. The pool water was as clear as it ...
customer_reviews.text: The first year it was great. The pool water was as clear as it was when I put on the cover. I did use the winterizing kit as well.. but none of the surface water bled into the pool water that I could tell. the 2nd year (this year) the water was still pretty clear, however the cover is starting to get big holes in it where it sits on the edge of the pool.. So I may be able to use it one more year.. but.. i might have to look for something else.. I doubt i would buy one from these guys again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These tubes are not worth it. I thought I would give hem a try since the tarp I bought last year from Amazon didn't hold up. Well the tubes popped and the tarp slid down into my pool, the tarp that was suppose to "hold" the tubes also ripped. My main concern living in Pa is at the end of the this I may even need to purchase a new liner! Worst product ever! I should also add that the tarp was even tied at all the grommets and they tore!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: These are great . . . as long as they aren't exposed to sunlight!
customer_reviews.text: There 2 critical characteristics of a pool cover: that it is water proof, and that it is UV resistant. This cover is waterproof . . . till it sits in the sun for a few months. And then, it gets holes. I bought two of these in March, and just used them today, July 1. They had set outside, on a stack of wood, by the shed till now. Both covers had holes on the surface facing the sun. On the up side, they are cheap. On the down side, they are made cheap, really, really cheap.
customer_reviews.author: GaHillBilly

customer_reviews.title: Its a tarp
customer_reviews.text: It is literally a giant tarp that you anchor with sand bags. The size was fine, but our small dog was determined to walk on it from the moment we installed it. We watched her closely but sure enough, she stepped on it when we turned our heads. Fortunately we were concerned this would happen and were standing by - otherwise she would have had to swim under the tarp the length of the pool, which she definitely couldn't do. There are likely better ways to anchor it, like with hooks installed into the concrete, but we did not find the quality to be worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Is currently down on top of our mesh safety pool ...
customer_reviews.text: Is currently down on top of our mesh safety pool cover. We are using water bags to keep it secured on top of the cover. Hoping that the solid dark cover will prevent the large amount of algae growth we have experienced over the last few winters. We have had more snow than usual this year and we get tons of wind. We have not noticed any ripping. Every few weeks, we attempt to make this cover "tight" by readjusting the water bags. It has taken A LOT of wind. We use a hose that we lay on top of this cover that we pump start to drain excess water off prior to pulling it tight again.
customer_reviews.author: MrsRoro

customer_reviews.title: This cover leaks!  Not worth the trouble to save a few dollars.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is almost dragged into the pool after one winter. This means only one thing: it leaks! The cover pump has been running for days now to drain dirty water. I hope I can still get the cover up without throwing all the debris into the pool but I probably have to scoop by hand a lot. 8 years warranty is a joke. Don't buy. I will go to Leslie's Pool Supply to get a two years one this fall since It truly lasts two years. I will call manufacturer but I don't know if they will refund me. I won't accept a replacement and you know why. It's not worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: I'd call this a "Value Pool Cover"  - no way will last 8 years
customer_reviews.text: I've not found any pool cover that will last more than a few years. These things just get destroyed over time. They give you an "8" year warranty - but trust me you will never see anything from that warranty. They will discount the amount each year and then if they do allow a claim the "shipping and handling" will be just about the same price as a new one. Yet all and all - I like this. I hope to get 2 perhaps 3 years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: JP Vic

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 winters
customer_reviews.text: It lasted two winters, but we used it a third because it's what we had. There were holes on it in places that touched the water. The first year, we tried the blue wave tubes, but they didn't make it a whole year, so we used concrete blocks. No damage from the blocks, and we didn't bother trying to use the warranty. If you buy this, plan on using it just one season. Anything more than that is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Blodgett

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2017. It's supposed to be an 8 year but it's not. After having it on the pool as a winter cover twice the fabric just tears apart. Also, even durign the first year, it's not watertight and that's the whole purpose of such a cover. Water leaks from the pool onot the cover and vice versa. When laying a submersible pump on the cover to remove the water the pump sinks about a foot and water keeps leaking from the pool into the pump area.
customer_reviews.author: Johan Schoneveld

customer_reviews.title: Tissue paper would have been better
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I was thinking when I purchased this cover after now reading the reviews. This thing is garbage. After installing cover and about twenty water bags I noticed about three slices in the cover. It's literally falling apart and it's brand new. I'm not sending it back only because I don't want to go through the trouble of recovering the pool again. Avoid problems and don't buy this cover. A week after install: Cover now has another 2' slice in the center of the cover. Now I have to buy another cover to go over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love the color and the width and length but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the width and length but it had several holes in the cover before we put it on the pool. I don't think I would order this again . Bought it in Aug ahead of time so we would have it by the time we close in Oct . But you must fill out warranty card before 10 days of purchase. Well I didn't open the box until I was ready to cover. I'll learn from this mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel W.

customer_reviews.title: Pool Cover
customer_reviews.text: 8/2016 -This cover has a warranty, right size but it is very thin . Don't seem durable at all I will see how it holds up for the winter. 9/2017-The pool cover just barely made it to two summers/ years. By This early summer it was Gawd awful with the rough rain and winter. It is very very thin and flimsy. I paid $90 for mine but I see it now $56.00. It’s not really expected to last 8 that’s false. I may buy it again for this price 😆And honestly I buy pool covers every two years anyway none really last as long as they say. Unless I get a professional to install one.
customer_reviews.author: Haskins

customer_reviews.title: One season cover regardless of warranty.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cover based on the reasonable price an 8 year warranty. Cover only lasted 1 winter. When removed last spring, it had deteriorated and had small holes. I decided to try it in the fall but the holes allow the pool water to weep onto the cover top. If I try to pump the water off, it will lower my pool water level. The cover in not worth any price and should state that it is for one season of use. Company will find lots of excuses why not to honor the warranty. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Camargo

customer_reviews.title: Good for only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This covered worked great the first year. Here it is the second year and water leaked through the cover. There are not any noticible tears or rips. By the time I noticed water was leaking through the cover, it was too late for me to drain out all the rain and snow melt because ice has developed and I didn't want to rip my liner. If you are buying this and plan on only using it for a year, then this is the cover for you. If you plan on using this cover multiple years, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: tbro

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We were hesitant to buy a pool cover but so glad we did! This cover has kept our pool so clean! It is much thicker than we anticipated and truly holds all of the rain and debris. It is easy to remove, fold up and store when not in use. It has saved us A LOT of money already. :-) $$ The quality is the best! If you are sick of having to shock your pool after every storm or having to clean it our before every use then you need this cover. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Seams leak and rip
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cover for the first time in 2018. When we started to drain it in the spring of 2019, we noticed our water level below the cover dropping. The seams were not holding and we ended up pumping out our pool water through the tarp. We cashed in on the warranty and paid $35 to ship a new one. We just started pumping the water off again and it has a huge rip on the seam. We will not be cashing in the warranty this time. It's going straight to the trash and we will be buying something else next time.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Had this cover for one year and one month. The reviews for this were good. When we received it we were very skeptical as it seemed slightly thicker than a kitchen garbage bag. No one has walked on it, held down with the correct water baffles. The cover is useless it is completely dry rotted.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Lasted One Season
customer_reviews.text: We bought this two years ago. After one season, the cover had holes and deteriorated. It was replaced under the warranty. I was told it was very unusual to happen. This past season we used the new replacement cover. We had the same exact results. They cover didn't last one season and they will not longer warranty it because they say it "melted" We live in NY nothing melts here during the winter. Every other pool cover we owned always lasted minimum of 5 years. This is a cheap piece of junk. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G

customer_reviews.title: Misleading warranty
customer_reviews.text: Warranty isn't even worth the paper they waste to write it on. To start, it's only ONE YEAR for full value. Year 2 it drops to 50%, and so on until year 8 when you get 5% (!) And, YOU have to pay for the return shipping. The material is very cheap and ages rapidly. Consider this a single-season only item, and then trash it.
customer_reviews.author: Grumps

customer_reviews.title: It’s porous so you can’t keep puddles off it....
customer_reviews.text: Who knew it was porous? Pool water leaks out into huge puddles on top...I don’t see how anyone can make it taught without a couple of hundred dollars of “pillows” underneath...just was not what I was expecting...we also have an oval pool so lots of extra fabric...you need more sizes and a couple of common pool shapes available maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra T.

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This cover is the best value for the price considering I have never had a pool cover last more than 2 years regardless of manufacturers claims. The only problem is out of the box it is not folded In a manner that allows for covering the pool. It must be spread out and refolded so it can be dragged over the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even last a season.
customer_reviews.text: We live in southern Alabama so it doesn’t get super cold. I bought this one thinking it’ll last 8 years. It was only covering the pool for 8 months and when we were removing it holes and thinned places appeared. The nasty water got in the pool!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. Parent-Lew

customer_reviews.title: Really Thin an Rips Easy
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box and unrolled the cover I was quite surprised at how thin the cover was. The seams around the grommets ripped as I moved the cover in to place with no weight on the cover at all. Not worth the money. Pool is closed so I cannot just remove the cover. Need to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: OliverG

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 winters.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this winter cover in Sep 2017 for winter 2017-18 and 2018-19 and 2019-20. The last winter the cover started to shred apart and created a massive hole on the side of the pool. It's filthy pieces broke and went into the water and was a complete mess. So much for the 8 year promise that the cover has. :(
customer_reviews.author: Brad Foster

customer_reviews.title: already ripped 1 month old
customer_reviews.text: I just closed my pool a month early because i was going on vaction and not going to be using my pool. the cover is on about a month and i already see a hole in it. how ridiculous its summer, nothing heavy on it now i have to buy another one before the actual cold weather starts
customer_reviews.author: Philip Rabbetts

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: It is supposed to have a warranty on the product. I am researching to determine because it did not even last eight months. The seam in the middle where they joined two parts ripped open and of course that allowed for garbage etc. to get in the pool. The whole purpose was to be able to cover the pool over the winter months, and be able to reopen during the season without having to remove leaves and debris from the pool. I am very unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pool cover just ok
customer_reviews.text: The item was damaged when I opened it. It had a cut threw the plastic packaging and one layer of the cover. it also was not enough over hang to proper secure the cover on the sides. I would suggest ordering one size up to get enough extra on the sides of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as expected based on stated dimensions and ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as large as expected based on stated dimensions and other covers I've purchased of the same dimensions. Has been on pool a couple of months, when I lifted a section to check pool, I could see sunlight through the cover which I did not expect and assume it means there is a problem. We'll see how clean the pool is when it's opened.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for single person install
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I would have is this product is really not easy for one person to install. The fold method for packaging makes it extremely difficult for a single person to unfold and deploy over a pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after the summer of 2017. When I got the product it felt thin, compared to a previous pool cover I purchased from a pool supply store. That cover lasted for more than 5 years. This product lasted through the winter. My area got pretty bad weather-heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disapointed. It is very thin material and it is acutally 25 - feet wide. Which meant that I had to fold 2.5 feet on each side for it to fit . The straps are loops of the same thin material and I doubt they will hold up in a windy condition. Because I had to fold it to make it fit I had to modify the sides and put in my own gromments
customer_reviews.author: T. C. Noble

customer_reviews.title: Holes in cover
customer_reviews.text: First year using this cover. It already has holes in it. I am literally pumping water out of my pool instead of off the cover. I have no water left in shallow end. Had to start filling up pool yesterday. Cover is still on pool. It is not a pool liner issue. Had it replaced last year. Pool is holding the water I am adding. Very dissatisfied. Will not order again!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Word

customer_reviews.title: You will have to replace after 1-2 years!
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of the warranty, which you have to pay for shipping etc etc etc and it is sliding, based on time of purchase it will be less. Either you pay MORE now for a nice cover or you do like me and you buy one of these every year because you have $60 not $600.
customer_reviews.author: TheElliott’s

customer_reviews.title: Fake warranty
customer_reviews.text: 8 year warranty? Fake news. This tarp is paper thin. Tears easier than paper and the warrant is complete crap (non existent). Don’t waste your money. Better off sewing ziplock bags together
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Torn in they first year I installed. Have to wmpty whole pool.
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever. I SAYS 8 YEAR warranty and i just bought its last winter. It ripped from the middle from seam and they whole pool water got dirty. I had frogs and tadpoles along with all the leaves dirt and other stuff in pool. Had to empty the whole 20×40 pool and get it cleaned before refilling it. Cost me around 400 just for water and another 350 to get it cleaned. Not worth the money. Buy it if you want to pay 10 times the cost of cover when opening.
customer_reviews.author: ankit

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Tarp - Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was less than 4 months old. Almost ALL the Eyelets pulled off or loosened up. But the tarp held up! But if you don't have any good enough to hold it down, what good is the tarp! They want you to send it back a $24 to get a new one, which is about $43 new.... Don't BUY! Will not last a year!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Clough

customer_reviews.title: Very thin, corner ripped immediately out of the box.  After just a few months, it's dry rotted.
customer_reviews.text: We've bought cheaper pool covers for years. Most of them we get a year out of, some 2-3 years and we expect 1-3 years max for the economy covers. This cover didn't even last 3 months before it's dry rotted. It got a hole in it immediately out of the box and new holes show up daily. I don't recommend Blue Wave pool covers.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight...good for a couple of years...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cover in 2017... it didn’t last but for the price I will order again knowing I’ll have to replace in a couple of years...it’s light weight so easy to handle....years ago was able to buy much thicker & heavier weight...but took 4-5 people to cover & remove...also a lot more expensive...Just be aware if you buy this cover...realize you’ll need to replace often !!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Leaves and other crap from getting into the pool.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my underground pool. I expect to get a couple years out of it if not more. The eight year warranty seems like a real stretch The price was fair and it should do a good job of keeping the Leaves and other crap from getting into the pool.
customer_reviews.author: donald williams

customer_reviews.title: not the actual size they claim should have ordered the next size up,
customer_reviews.text: well my pool is 18'x40' the description claimed the cover would be 25'x45' in actual size. IT WAS NOT AND DID NOT FIT. it was short all around. The green tarp is covering almost 4 1/2 ' the black did cover and the black is your cover that is on right, right on the edge of my pool and the sides barely were covered by the cover.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: The "8 year warranty" is deceptive. The cover lasted two seasons, and I replaced it due to minor tearing through Amazon Prime (free shipping). Warranty Dept. at Blue Wave was engaged, and after all of their requests were met, they offered to ship a new cover for more than the cost of the replacement. Since I had already replaced the cover, I asked for the "50% of the cost in lieu of the product which they declined. The cover is useful (to go over the real cover and keeps out any sunlight, but do not make the "8 year Warranty" part of your decision to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Threw out after 4 winters
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t last 8 years. It was so torn in 4 years it was unusable. My pool is covered in an enclosure so it was not from harsh winters or wind damage. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one winter. When we removed it and went ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one winter. When we removed it and went to fold up, noticed many tears and holes. Have to send back to get warranty (pro rated price that applies to you purchasing another). Not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: MSC

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: We have ordered this 5 years in a row. Seems it gets cheaper every year. Supposed to have 8 year warranty. We never get through 1 year. This time, we took it out of the bag,, ready to put on the pool, and notice 1 of the seams has about 3 foot area that it is separated. Of course I have the option to return. unfortunately, once you have this out of the box, there is no way to fit it back into that box for the return.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Thin Cover
customer_reviews.text: This is a very thin cover, so it won't last a lot of years. However, it has managed to get me through this winter with lots of snow and very cold temps, so it was money well spent. I will know more when it is actually time to open my pool later this spring. UPDATE 8/29/2018: I have been purchasing one cover every winter. I do not expect to get more than 1 season, so I order, open the new cover and discard in the spring. No cleanup, no storage and no mess. They are thin, but I have been purchasing this cover for several years and they always get me through one season.
customer_reviews.author: momof4

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: Product looked good when first received. Now it looks terrible, you can see thru it in areas, it looks like cheese cloth. Has holes and tears. Cheap quality. Good for one, possibly two years and throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Putter

customer_reviews.title: Only held up for two seasons
customer_reviews.text: Lasted for 2 years. Need to get another one for next winter and will be looking for one that will hold up. This was flimsy out of the box
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would not recommend Blue wave pool cover, don't waste your money, like I did
customer_reviews.text: Closed my pool today.took out the pool cover,it is paper thin. Comes with 8 year warranty, I'm worried it won't make 1 year. You know when it tears they'll say I did something wrong or some other lame excuse to nullify the warranty. I usually buy mine at a discount store, Ocean State Job Lots,.about the same price.but much better quality. Totally disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: Nope nope nope
customer_reviews.text: The measurements are not correct, ordered my pool size which was suppose to have a 4 ft overage. Didnt even covers pool
customer_reviews.author: suzanne

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Sorely disappointed. I ordered the water bags and 25x45 cover for my pool in anticipation of closing at this time of the season. The 4 of the bags leaked as I filled them. The cover is thin and less than quality . I also ordered the net which i haven't opened yet.
customer_reviews.author: 4all2c

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this pool cover as we were blowing through one a year. I find the quality better than others I've purchased.Tgere is also a warranty which is a huge plus. I highly recommend so far, I'll update after the winter. So far great quality, great price.
customer_reviews.author: daneault6

customer_reviews.title: Rip off - don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. It was "installed" in October and here we are January and it has several rips. I have had to duck tape the holes so the dirty water doesn't fall in my pool water. Honestly, I think a tarp from Home Deport would have been better - I will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CD159

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even know where to start. We noticed the cover had a rip in it after we already covered the pool. The grommets pulled away from the material as soon as we put a peg in them. My husband said it seems to be dry rotted and it probably won’t last through the winter. Save your money and buy a tarp.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee N

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pool cover!
customer_reviews.text: This pool cover is very nice. It covers the pool with plenty of room on all sides/ends. It's plenty sturdy enough for the rough northern winters we have in northern New York.
customer_reviews.author: JoanaFark

customer_reviews.title: Junk! This tore and cracked!
customer_reviews.text: No 8 year warranty honored. Was a mess after the first season. We had to duct tape it in many spots.Spend your money on something better
customer_reviews.author: Debi G

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, doesn't last. Disposable.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight and tears easily. It is basically a large size tarp of the poorest quality that you could buy at any hardware store. I consider it a disposable item after one year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Thor71

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money will not last
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one season used text second season only to Learn upon removing it had allowed trash into pool . Unable to locate a contact seller anywhere in ads . May contact Amazon for assistance .Doubt that will get me anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M.Tyler

customer_reviews.title: The cover seems lightweight. I purchased all new tubes ...
customer_reviews.text: The cover seems lightweight. I purchased all new tubes to go around it as well. hopefully it will last a few years. Well it only lasted 2 years even though I purchased water tubes to go around the entire cover. It wore around the edge of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Dockguy

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Not very good , pictures show little holes in the seams cheap material and it won’t las the first heavy snow in pa. Have bought numerous winter covers and this is the worst
customer_reviews.author: L. Regelman

customer_reviews.title: Bad item
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this item it was bad service. The cover has hole and a patch. I am already late for closing my pool. Even with the hole and patch, I closed the pool. I am looking to return it next opening season
customer_reviews.author: Nizar Alkhatib

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 18x36 in ground oval pool. This thing is huge. I would buy one size smaller next time
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Can't blame it on the weather because we have had many bad winters before
customer_reviews.text: We have had a pool for 18 years and have NEVER had any trouble with a winter cover until this year. This cover ripped and fell into the pool this week. Can't blame it on the weather because we have had many bad winters before. We have always bought our winter covers locally and was always able to use a cover for 2 years. I saw this cover and it was less expensive and said "8 year", and decided to give it a try. I DO NOT recommend it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After the second year of use the tarp started separating ...
customer_reviews.text: After the second year of use the tarp started separating at the seems and the material started separating in different areas. THIS IS NOT AN * YEAR TARP. READ THE REVEIWS. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT. 8 year tarp is very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Noon

customer_reviews.title: Bought too big lol
customer_reviews.text: A great cover. Thick enough and strong. Make sure to measure properly. Accidentally bought too big but will be buying the correct size for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Megsy

customer_reviews.title: Avoid purchasing this, holes after less than a month!
customer_reviews.text: There is no way this is an 8 year pool cover. Didn't even hold up after covering our pool for less than a month. What a waste of money, avoid buying this one. Very flimsy...
customer_reviews.author: C. Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Really just a giant (and lightweight) tarp. I agree with other reviewers, no way it makes it through the warranty period. Tree trimmer was working above the tarp and a falling limb did poke a hole in it. NOTE: Warranty is FULL only for the first year, then only a fraction thereafter. But for only $75, it's OK to buy one every year for what it will save in chemicals. I'm not using it with water weights, instead I'm holding it in place with bungee cords (which is not a recommended method), and the corner grommets (which were the most stressed) gave out..
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Looked like a good cover when it arrived but it did not hold up as expected. We were lucky to get just one season out of it. It ripped in so many places. So much for the 8 years it should have lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Dalks

customer_reviews.title: Great cover so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good great value for the money, lets see how long it goes!
customer_reviews.author: bozjovi

customer_reviews.title: quality bad
customer_reviews.text: this product has a 8-year warranty, but the quality is bad since the water under the cover is leaked out to the top the cover. The 8-year warranty is totally cheat since nobody you can contact.
customer_reviews.author: Supervisor

customer_reviews.title: Ripped the 2nd day!
customer_reviews.text: Ripped after the first day covering the pool. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: third party warranty company is a joke
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to contact blue wave since May of 2020 concerning the warranty on a pool cover that has torn in several places after less than one year..no response from them...I would never buy a blue wave product again, this company has the worst customer service department that I have ever encountered. Buyer Beware..
customer_reviews.author: john scelfo

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last.
customer_reviews.text: This cover didn’t last one winter. I pumped it out religiously but still ended up with a mess at the start of the season. Many holes and tears, and dry rotted fabric from UV damage. We live in New Jersey. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: gtrlovr

customer_reviews.title: apears to be a good cover but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these covers over the years and so far they have done what I thought they should do.
customer_reviews.author: Denis C. Kenshalo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: After 11 months laying on top of a ground level pool, the tarp itself deteriorated. Blue Wave did honor their warranty agreement, after sending many pictures via email, then said I would have to pay for shipping. A cost of $**.** and will not allow local pickup.
customer_reviews.author: TGCTLGNS

customer_reviews.title: Great cover for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great cover for the price. Seems sturdy but lightweight. We got a 20x44 for our 20x40 Inground pool as we have some odd cutouts and fits great! I’m sure it won’t last 8 years but it should do the job for a couple until we get our hard cover!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Blake

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Starting coming assist after first winter. It’s really just a light weight tarp so I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sarcadi Family

customer_reviews.title: Garbage bag material!
customer_reviews.text: I wish i could have rated it -5! I’m not sure what I was thinking when I ordered this winter cover. Should have been you get what you pay for. It is like garbage bag weight. It had a hole in it as soon as we put it on. I looked at it tonight and there are holes in it on the sides of the pool. It will be a one winter pool cover. Spend more money and get a better one than this.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Beyers

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: It usually lasts 2 winters - BUT for the price what do you expect - Warranty is a joke, they want the WHOLE cover returned at my cost in order to look @ it and see if they will cover the Warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Funskrmom

customer_reviews.title: Bought 8, have 5 tubes working.
customer_reviews.text: 6 out of 8 worked, 2 leaked immediately. Two months later I have 5 working. Also if you over fill they become tubes and roll away!
customer_reviews.author: Jennywren

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: The cover had holes in it after 1 year. When I uncovered my pool the pollen and small particles of dirt in the pool was unreal. I have been covering this pool for 38 years and it is by far the worst shape my water has ever been. Costing me time and money to get the water cleared up. I will not purchase another one. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this pool cover in Sept. Put it on in October and after having a mild winter it is tearing all over. It has an 8 year warranty and we have contacted the company and they will not respond.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Girl

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different pool covers over the years, and this is by far the one I've been happiest with. Its light weight makes in easy to handle, yet it is every bit as strong as other "HEAVY duty" and more expensive covers. It is waterproof and floats. It was the size specified. It has gromments around the entire perimeter 18 inches apart and at all the corners, plus water tube sleeves. My experience with this pool cover has been entirely positive.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: the product came twice the size that was listed
customer_reviews.text: The cover arrived so much large almost twice the size then what was order , You could not maneuver it in the pool area and most importantly you CAN NOT pack it back up to put in the box to return never fit !! Very disappointed waste of a Saturday afternoon trying to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Solak

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst covers I have ever worked with
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst covers I have ever worked with. Very hard to unfold for this size pool and after the first week of rain the cover just sank to the bottom of the pool and all the leaves were in the pool. Would not recommend for an area with alot of snow or rain. This was a waste of my money. Only saving grace is I can use it as a very cheap grade tarp. Very thin. tears easily
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! This lasted maybe 3 months before water started sleeping through the cover. Contacted seller 2x and all you get is an automated response. 8 year warranty is worthless. Again, look elsewhere. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: Product damaged.
customer_reviews.text: There was a hole in the liner. We still used it but was disappointed to find the hole.
customer_reviews.author: birds

customer_reviews.title: 8 YEAR WARRANTY? Ha! It didn’t last 8 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the worst pool cover on the market... I put it up 2 months ago and it already ripped! Freakin crazy that I haven’t used it for a the winter. Trust me, spend extra and buy a better one. I won’t even bother calling for a refund given the so called 8 year warranty! It BULL!
customer_reviews.author: Rashid Baydoun

customer_reviews.title: Porous weave
customer_reviews.text: This cover did not last one PA winter. Cover pump pulled water through the cover and drained a lot of water needlessly.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Not Tough Enough For South Florida
customer_reviews.text: It arrived April 12, 2020 and in less than a month, the material has succumbed to the heat and humidity of Miami. The puddles of water you see on the cover are due to water seeping through. The white stuff, we have no clue. It seems to be whatever the material was sealed with deteriorating. This purchase was definitely a dud.
customer_reviews.author: D. Valdes

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool cover in September of 2018 to cover my pool for the winter. It's March 21st 2019 and the pool cover has already ripped halfway through. The materia is cheap, not durable enough. I recommend you stay away from this product. Now I have to seek out another brand for my upcoming winter. I just threw money out the window on this pool cover bummer.
customer_reviews.author: gregory

customer_reviews.title: Pool Cover
customer_reviews.text: It ripped as soon as we put the cover over the pool. Also, this cover is not for a 14X28 Grecian Pool. Not enough coverage at the ends to put bags etc to keep cover from going into the pool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy no support from seller
customer_reviews.text: The cover was barley 32 feet in length with no additional length for over lap. Contacted the seller....give the required information and never heard another thing..........
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made !
customer_reviews.text: Extremely thin material! Looks like it will tear easily! Mostly likely will not make it they the winter!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you live where it snows!
customer_reviews.text: Would give it 0 stars if I could. We live in NY so we deal with a lot of snow/ice. If you do too DO NOT by this. The cover is basically in shreds.
customer_reviews.author: David Cohen

customer_reviews.title: don't like the fact that it's advertised with 8 years of ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't look it would last me even an year, don't like the fact that it's advertised with 8 years of warranty and then comes with a paper stating to mail in the receipt and the warranty confirmation paper agreeing to the partial warranty reduction per year otherwise the warranty is limited to one year.
customer_reviews.author: Touseef Z.

customer_reviews.title: POOR quality/split after weeks of use!
customer_reviews.text: Just short of a couple of months this cover split in various areas. The cover was put on in middle August so it was not the weather or length of time on the pool that caused the splits. I bought a size that was in excess of what I needed so it wasn't a matter of pulling just POOR quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jean T. of Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: This is our second year for one. We love it. Just wish it were a prettier color.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Kemper

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but this year there's water coming up through the cover. Not sure that's supposed the happen after a year.
customer_reviews.author: L. Geese

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted...description was misleading
customer_reviews.text: A pool net...mesh should let water pass through it...this one doesn't. It is made of very light weight plastic that can hardly take the tension to hold it over the pool. If it weren't such a hassle I would send it back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frogley

product_meta.title: Blue Wave BWC744 Bronze 8-Year 16-ft x 24-ft Rectangular In Ground Pool Winter Cover,Dark Navy Blue
product_meta.description: Size:16 by 24-FeetThe dirt defender bronze grade cover has the strength and durability of covers costing twice as much. Rugged polyethylene scrim and coating means this cover can withstand winter's worst. Dirt defender covers are u.v. protected so they will last for-years in direct sunlight. The cover's black underside retards algae growth and heat sealed seams means a crystal clear pool next spring. The big 4-feet overlap ensures a proper fit for above ground pools unlike covers with 3-feet overlaps. Dirt defender covers are held secure with a heavy duty cable and winch tightener that is anchored by rip proof metal grommets. Backed by an 8-year warranty (1-year full rated). This dirt defender cover comes in a dark navy blue with a black underside.
feature_bullets: Integral cover loops to secure water tubes
Protects against sun, snow, ice and wind
Integral cover loops to secure water tubes
5 foot overlap to ensure there is no stretching or ripping

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars882 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
